edu.ncsu.csc.cucumber

Class RecipeStepDefs

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.cucumber.RecipeStepDefs

  • public class RecipeStepDefs
extends java.lang.Object
    Step Defs (Cucumber) for interacting with the Recipe model to ensure it is appropriately tested.
    Author:
    Kai Presler-Marshall, Sarah Elder

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecipeStepDefs

        public RecipeStepDefs(SharedRecipeData srd)
        Constructor for the RecipeStepDefs. Used to keep track of CoffeeMaker's state to ensure that the test completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        srd - SharedRecipeData; a backup of the recipes to ensure that the CoffeeMaker is behaving appropriately.

    • Method Detail

      • existingRecipes

        @Given(value="^the CoffeeMaker already has (\\d+) Recipes$")
public void existingRecipes(int numRecipes)
                                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Deletes the existing batch of recipies in the CoffeeMaker and then populates it with a new batch of Recipies.
        Parameters:
        numRecipes - The number of recipies that should be in the RecipeBook
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the number of recipies to add is greater than the max allowed

      • addRecipeWithName

        @Given(value="^the Coffeemaker has a recipe named (.+)$")
public void addRecipeWithName(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a recipe with the name provided
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the new Recipe to create.

      • validDeleteByName

        @When(value="^I delete the recipe called (.+)$")
public void validDeleteByName(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes the Recipe with the name provided.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the recipe to delete

      • invalidDeleteByName

        @When(value="^I attempt to delete a nonexistent recipe called (.+)$")
public void invalidDeleteByName(java.lang.String name)
        Attempts to delete a recipe with the name provided. The recipe won't exist and this will fail
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the recipe to attempt to delete

        @When(value="^I submit valid values for name: (.+); cost: (\\d+); and ingredients: (\\d+) coffee, (\\d+) milk, (\\d+) sugar, (\\d+) chocolate$")

        Parameters:

        cost - Cost of the new Recipe
        coffeeAmt - Amount of Coffee needed for the new Recipe

        sugarAmt - Amount of Sugar needed for the new Recipe
        chocolateAmt - Amount of Chocolate needed for the new Recipe

      • validEditRecipe

        @When(value="^I edit that recipe to have cost: (\\d+); and ingredients: (\\d+) coffee, (\\d+) milk, (\\d+) sugar, (\\d+) chocolate$")

      • invalidEditRecipe

        @When(value="^I invalidly edit that recipe to have cost: (.+); and ingredients: (.+) coffee, (.+) milk, (.+) sugar, (.+) chocolate$")
public void invalidEditRecipe(java.lang.String cost,

      • recipeEditedSuccessfully

        @Then(value="^the recipe is successfully edited$")
public void recipeEditedSuccessfully()
        Ensure that a recipe was edited as expected by comparing the actual results in the CoffeeMaker to what is stored in the backup

        @Then(value="^the recipe is not edited$")
public void recipeEditedUnsuccessfully()
        Ensure that a recipe was _not_ edited as expected by comparing the actual results in the CoffeeMaker to what is stored in the backup

        Parameters:
        ingredient - The ingredient that should trigger the error
